**** A security vulnerability exists in Windows Hyper-V that could allow an attacker to elevate privileges on a Windows system. The vulnerability is caused by an error in the way Hyper-V handles certain virtual machine operations. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by creating a malicious virtual machine and then using it to gain access to the host system.

**** A security vulnerability exists in the MSHTML component of Microsoft's Internet Explorer web browser. The vulnerability could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code on a vulnerable system. The vulnerability is caused by an error in the way MSHTML handles certain types of webpage content. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by convincing a user to visit a malicious website or by sending a malicious email attachment.
